title: Remote for LG TV & LG Blu-Ray players
summary: LG TV Alternative Universal Remote Free 7 day trial
description: Free 7 day trial version of the main MyAV Pro app that can also control many other IP controllable devices.Unofficial WI-Fi & IR remote control for LG  Televisions."LG" is a trademark of  the LG Corporation. This app is in no way affiliated with LG, it simply works with some of their products.Your LG Smart TV or Blu Ray player must be connected to your router AND YOUR ROUTER MUST HAVE uPnP ENABLED... if the app doesn't find your LG Smart TV the please CONTACT US by email or read the instructions on our website. If you have a Samsung/HTC Android device with an IR(InfraRed) blaster, this will be detected by MyAV and older IR equipment can be controlled too. You can also buy 3rd party IR blasters like the Orvibo AllOne or Broadlink RM ProMyAV can also control a lot of other devices around your home, not just LG. descriptionHTML:
Free 7 day trial version of the main MyAV Pro app that can also control many other IP controllable devices.

Unofficial WI-Fi & IR remote control for LG Televisions."LG" is a trademark of the LG Corporation. This app is in no way affiliated with LG, it simply works with some of their products.

Your LG Smart TV or Blu Ray player must be connected to your router AND YOUR ROUTER MUST HAVE uPnP ENABLED... if the app doesn't find your LG Smart TV the please CONTACT US by email or read the instructions on our website.
If you have a Samsung/HTC Android device with an IR(InfraRed) blaster, this will be detected by MyAV and older IR equipment can be controlled too. You can also buy 3rd party IR blasters like the Orvibo AllOne or Broadlink RM Pro

MyAV can also control a lot of other devices around your home, not just LG.
Set-top boxes: Dish, DirecTV, TiVo and Comcast Xfinity X1 Support (Manually add in the setup menu)
AVR receivers: Denon, Marantz, Onkyo, Rotel, Harman, Sony, Yamaha, Pioneer, Arcam, Anthem
Streamers: Roku, Western Digital, Kodi, Mede8er
Blu-Ray: Oppo, Sony, Samsung, LG, Panasonic, Pioneer, Arcam
TVs: Sony, Samsung,Sharp, Panasonic,LG, Philips, Bush
Projectors: Sony, JVC, Epson (maually add IP address)
Lighting: Philips Hue

For the UK, USA, Germany, Brazil, France, Belgium, Australia, New Zealand, Spain, Netherlands, Denmark, Norway & Sweden channel shortcuts are available. These can be renumbered by dragging them to the pop-up keypad that appears when you long-click on a shortcut.

Features:
-App shortcuts (if TV channels are found these are place after those, they can be filtered in the settings menu, move or added to favourites)
-Channel logos, Genre/HD/Radio/Favourites Filters 
-Can control many other devices around the home

MODEL

FEATURES

FEEDBACK

LG Compatible LG TVs
2017: All webOS 3.0 based

2016: All webOS 3.0 based

2015: All webOS 2.0 based (not webOS lite)

2014: All webOS based (not webOS lite)

2013: Should work with all 2013 smart TVmodels

Compatible LG Blu-Ray players
2014-2017 most models
2013: BP-530, BP730 (tested)

2011: BD650, BD670 (tested)
comments: They try to charge you right away. Im not purchasing something I don't know it will work.
I literally just downloaded it and when trying to see if it would work got a pop up that said my seven day trail was over and I needed to pay to keep it... Umm, no thanks.
Took my money and it doesn't work.
So far so good.  Great for hotels
recentChanges: Support for Sky Pro & Sky HD (Cable) Germany
